task.title: Stamping Log Entries From Your Workflow Banner
task.shortdesc: When uploading or editing a CWRC object it’s recommended to add a workflow stamp which would provide info about the status of the object (i.e. in progress, under review, published, etc). This is especially useful in the context of larger projects where multiple members are working on the same object / document.

step.cmd: Click on the Review these here link in the workflow banner. This banner is persistently located in the CWRC page.

info.p: Please keep your unstamped log entries up-to-date (unlike the screenshot below).

step.cmd: Click on the Tag Workflow you would like to stamp.
Fill out the Workflow Activity form.

info.p: This defines where the stamp will belong. For example is this a published or unpublished object. Have you created the stamp or would you like it to be deleted. Choose the option that best fits the unstamped entry.

substep.cmd: Select a stamp to add to the object.
substep.info: The stamps define what project the entry belongs to and the status of that entry within a project. For example if this is an orlando object that you have checked for tagging, choose the orl:CFT-Checked for tagging. The stamps are unique for each project (created by project administrators). If you have a CWRC document that you have checked for tagging you would stamp it as cwrc:cre-repository item created and then add the status “In progress” or “Pending” (for more information see below).

info.p: This defines what the current status is of the unstamped log entry. Is it ready to be published? Select Complete. Does it need to be edited? Select In Progress. When viewing a stamped entry you can add an additional stamp (you would do this if you further edited the object, for example). Click on See all workflow stamps.
info.option: This brings up the same form (in a smaller size) below the the stamp History column on the right side of the page. Fill out the information (see above) and click on Save.

info.p: In either option you can notify that you have stamped or assign the entry to another project user. For more information see ___ and ___.
